page.title: 11SHOPPING
page.content: Kilsyth Main Street is quite a long street. There are several side streets leading from it. It has four empty shops but some new ones have been built at the top of the town. There is one public bar,the Scarecrow, which is also a restaurant. A stream runs through the town and there is the remains of an old railway bridge too. Many Kilsyth people do their grocery shopping in West Burnside Street,at the supermarket. Other shops sell confectionery, hardware and stationery. There are about five bakeries. Although there are some clothes shops,most people prefer to go to Glasgow, Kirkintilloch, Falkirk or Stirling for clothes. Some people use a mail order catalogue because it is more convenient.
